item.title: American Investors Embrace a Less-Democratic India
item.description: India’s economic might is on the rise, but it’s undergoing a democratic recession. American businesses seem to prefer this.

item.title: Paramount Faces a Mountain of Distrust
item.description: The ownership structure shades deal talks, leaving regular shareholders with few options aside from voting with their feet.

item.title: Gold Futures Hit Another Record on Geopolitical Tensions, Fed Hopes
item.description: Gold futures prices hit a fresh high, sustained by geopolitical tensions, monetary easing hopes, Chinese economic woes, central-bank buying and algorithmic trading.

item.title: HSBC to Sell Argentina Business in Latest Market Exit
item.description: HSBC Holdings is selling its Argentina business for over half a billion dollars, the bank’s latest exit from markets that are no longer core to its business strategy.

item.title: Commodities Rally Reflects a Better Economy, but Also Poses Inflation Risks
item.description: Climbing prices could set back the Federal Reserve’s plan to cut interest rates.

item.title: Biden's New Student-Loan Forgiveness Plan: Who Qualifies and How It Would Work
item.description: The plan would provide relief to millions who still owe more than they originally borrowed.

item.title: Treasury Yields Hit 2024 Highs
item.description: Benchmark Treasurys rose to their highest yields since November and stocks were little changed as investors awaited fresh inflation data.

item.title: Gold Hits New High as Central Banks Ramp Up Purchases
item.description: Gold closed at another record high, with momentum chiefly driven by central bank purchases.

item.title: Dollar May Stay Stronger for Longer
item.description: The dollar had been widely expected to weaken this year as the Federal Reserve starts to cut interest rates, but rate-cut expectations have been trimmed back sharply while U.S. elections and geopolitical uncertainty could also lift the currency.

item.title: Sorry, but Blood Tests Won't Replace Stool Samples or Colonoscopies Yet
item.description: Disappointing results for colon-cancer blood tests strengthen the investment thesis for Exact Sciences, which makes a stool-based test.

item.title: Jamie Dimon Warns U.S. Might Face Interest-Rate Spike
item.description: The head of JPMorgan Chase questioned the “soft landing” talk but said his bank is ready no matter what.

item.title: Shimao Shares Fall After China Bank Files Liquidation Petition
item.description: Shimao Group shares fell sharply after a Chinese state-run bank filed a liquidation petition against the heavily indebted developer, adding uncertainty to a proposed restructuring of offshore debt.

item.title: Doubts Creep In About a Fed Rate Cut This Year
item.description: Traders started the year predicting as many as seven rate cuts. Now, many are betting on one or two—or none.

item.title: Do Kwon Lost to the SEC. The U.S. Is Piling Up Other Crypto Wins, Too.
item.description: The decision was the latest in a series of federal court wins bolstering regulators’ efforts to force the freewheeling industry to comply with the same laws that govern the stock and bond markets.

item.title: Stock Funds Zoom to 9.1% Gain in First Quarter
item.description: Start to year was even better than hoped. Also: A flashback to the 30th anniversary of the Kidder Peabody bond scandal.

item.title: The Surprising Top Mutual Fund in the First Quarter
item.description: Hennessy Cornerstone Growth claims the No. 1 spot over the past year as small-to-midcap funds start to supplant the dominant large-cap growth funds.

item.title: Big Tech Has a Big Cash Problem
item.description: Any acquisitions companies such as Apple, Amazon or Microsoft attempt will bring scrutiny and delays.

item.title: Hash Out the Inheritance Now, or Fight Your Family Later
item.description: The toughest part of estate planning isn’t writing the will, but talking about it openly with the family.

item.title: Biotech Executive Who Bet on Rival's Stock Committed Insider Trading, Jury Says
item.description: The SEC won its “shadow trading’” case, extending the application of the law.

item.title: Am I Glad I Went to College? Well, It's Complicated
item.description: I never got my degree and I have lots of student debt. And yet…
